WorkItem.ClosedComment: The original issue wass resolved. Regarding item filters and localization start a new issue.
WorkItem.Description:
After switching to German language and updating all items from wowhead, I'm facing the problem that all items sold for emblems of frost are described with 
 
    Drops from Unknown Boss (Wowhead lacks data) in Icecrown Citadel
 
The link to wowhead shows correct data, so import routine might have a bug.
 
Version: 2.3.9
OS: WinXP, Win7-64
 
CU
Strolch@Arygos
WorkItem.Summary: [Items] "Wowhead lacks data" for items sold for emblems of frost

Comments.Message: I'm having the same problem without the translation. In addition all non tier EoF items are not showing up at all unless I have them equipped and I then get the Unknown boss message. EoF are marked on item template
The nontranslated problem should be fixed, for other languages we would need to enter translations for wowhead currency tables. Currently there's only a partial French translation.

OK this is getting old.

If you get this message on your gear "drops from unknown boss in icecrwon...wowhead lacks data" refresh from Armoury (since wowhead has no/wrong data don't use it....duh).

Now the gear has number of Frost Emblems that it costs and the viola item shows on list when filtered by Frost emblem options. 

Solves this problem and the "Frost emblem fails" issues.

Please think about what you are doing and complaining about prior to posting issues and discussions.

It should be getting added based on an ID number, not by name. As such Rawr would translate that ID number to the visual name of "Frost Emblem", regardless of user's locale, unless we specifically stated their localized name. The issue should be resolved, unless someone provides us specific translations and we can add them in.
We do base it on id, it's just that for some reason for French locale we're translating the source token name. I would imagine that messes up with item filters.

Now that you mention it, that does make sense, we shouldn't be translating to French at all, only English in order for the Filters to work properly (and to conform to the rule of US Armory data uniformity).
